subject: RE: [junit] Some questions about JUnit 4
msgSnippet: Elliotte, Thank you for the offer, but we are fairly certain that we do not want to include the graphical runners in JUnit 4. I can see that they might be
messageBody:
Elliotte,

Thank you for the offer, but we are fairly certain that we do not want to include the graphical runners in JUnit 4. I can see that they might be useful in a teaching situation, but we are assuming that an IDE will always be available or that the textual interface will suffice.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
> Sent: Tuesday, August 16, 2005 8:41 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Some questions about JUnit 4
>
> Kent Beck wrote:
>
> >> 5. The GUI test runners don't appear to be in Version4
> CVS. Will they
> >> return at some point?
> >
> > We don't have any plans to provide GUI test runners.
> >
>
> If someone were to port the JUnit 3 runners forward, would you be
> interested in including them? I often find myself teaching or
> writing in
> situations where I don't want to assume any particular IDE or the
> presence of an IDE at all.
>
> --
